title: ICE: "Got a scalar pair where a scalar was expected" -Zmir-opt-level=4  --emit=mir

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code ```Rust // run-rustfix #![allow(unused)] fn a() -> usize { 0 } //~^ ERROR return types are denoted using `->` fn bar(_: u32) {} fn baz() -> *const dyn Fn(u32) { unimplemented!() } fn foo() { match () { _ if baz() == &bar as &dyn Fn(u32) => (), () => (), } } fn main() { } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.62.0-nightly (878c7833f 2022-04-16) binary: rustc commit-hash: 878c7833f6c1ff10e2fd89074e5bd4ef5ff15936 commit-date: 2022-04-16 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.62.0-nightly LLVM version: 14.0.0 ``` ### Error output ``` ```
Backtrace
